title: The Article "the" belirtme hali eki
desc: Learn about how to talk about specific things using the article 'the' in Turkish

body.raw: ## The article ‚Äúthe‚Äù in Turkish - Belirtme Hali Eki --- Unlike English, the article ‚Äúthe‚Äù does not come before the noun in Turkish but is rather appended to the noun as a suffix. ‚Üí The suffix we add depends on the **last letter** of the noun. Here is a table to map the ‚Äúthe‚Äù suffix to a noun. ‚Üí if the last letter is **a consonant.** | Last Vowel | Suffix to be added | | --- | --- | | a | **ƒ±** | | e | **i** | | o | **u** | | √º | **√º** | | √∂ | **√º** | ‚Üí If the last letter is **a vowel.** | Last letter | Suffix to be added | | --- | --- | | a | y**ƒ±** | | e | y**i** | | o | y**u** | | √º | y**√º** | | √∂ | y**√º** | üìå If the last letter is a **vowel** then ‚Äúy‚Äù comes in between as a mediator between the two vowels. In Turkish two vowels do not come together back to back. It is one of the golden rules of Turkish. Words that have two consecutive vowels are **loanwords** Examples √áay ‚Üí Tea, √áay**ƒ±** ‚Üí the tea Ev ‚Üí House, Ev**i** ‚Üí the house Balkon ‚Üí Balcony, Balkon**u** ‚Üí the balcony G√ºl ‚Üí Rose, G√ºl**√º** ‚Üí the rose G√∂l ‚Üí Lake, G√∂l**√º** ‚Üí the lake Examples: Araba ‚Üí Car, Arabay**ƒ±** ‚Üí the car Sebze ‚Üí Vegetable, Sebzey**i** ‚Üí the vegetable Depo ‚Üí Warehouse, Depoy**u** ‚Üí the warehouse K√∂t√º ‚Üí Bad, K√∂t√ºy**√º** ‚Üí the bad --- Thanks for reading!
